item.title: 加拿大通胀率升至 2%，可能阻碍大幅降息
item.description: 加拿大的通胀率增幅超过预期，潜在的物价压力重新加快，这些小插曲可能会使政策制定者放弃在下个月连续第二次降息 50 个基点。【原文：Inflation in Canada rose by more than forecast and underlying price pressures reaccelerated, hiccups that may dissuade policymakers from a second straight 50 basis-point cut to interest rates next month.】

item.title: 微软发布软件以简化人工智能应用开发和模型切换
item.description:
该软件制造商还预览了新的芯片和 Office AI 功能。【原文：

The software maker also previewed new chips and Office AI features.

】

item.title: 缺失的石油桶使人们对国际能源署看跌 2025 年前景产生怀疑
item.description: 石油交易商们普遍赞同国际能源机构的观点，即明年的石油库存将会增加，但有理由认为库存的增加可能会比预测的要少。【原文：Oil traders broadly share the International Energy Agency’s view that stockpiles will grow next year — but there is reason to think the expansion could be smaller than forecast.】

item.title: 挪威 DNB 银行将佣金和收费目标提高一倍
item.description: 挪威国家银行（DNB Bank ASA）将佣金和手续费净额的增长目标提高了一倍，为即将到来的降息做准备，因为降息将给贷款利润率带来压力。【原文：DNB Bank ASA is doubling a goal for growth in net commissions and fees to prepare for coming interest rate cuts which will put pressure on margins on loans.】

item.title: 监督机构警告澳大利亚养老金索赔监督失灵
item.description: 澳大利亚养老金监管机构已就死亡抚恤金索赔处理问题向该国 3.9 万亿澳元（2.5 万亿美元）的养老金行业发出通知，而就在几天前，该监管机构还起诉了一家最大的基金公司，称其在处理死亡抚恤金索赔时出现了不可接受的延误。【原文：Australia’s pensions regulator has put the nation’s A$3.9 trillion ($2.5 trillion) industry on notice over the handling of death benefit claims, just days after it sued one of the largest funds for unacceptable delays.】

item.title: 津巴布韦上调电价引发 3,000 兆瓦能源投资
item.description: 津巴布韦决定采用反映成本的电价，这引发了能源行业的投资热潮，将有助于缓解其电力危机。【原文：Zimbabwe’s decision to adopt tariffs that reflect costs has sparked a wave of investments in the energy sector that will help ease its power crisis.】

item.title: 监督机构称法国应终止 EDF 的管制电价
item.description: 法国竞争管理机构周二建议，法国政府应取消法国电力公司（Electricite de France SA）的管制电价，以促进竞争对手的竞争。【原文：The French government should scrap Electricite de France SA’s regulated power tariffs to boost competition from rival suppliers, the nation’s competition authority recommended Tuesday.】

item.title: 特朗普的能源调整将放过碳捕集
item.description:
美国当选总统提名的环境保护局领导人选已经接受了二氧化碳捕集与封存技术。【原文：

The US president-elect’s pick to lead the Environmental Protection Agency has embraced CCS technology.

】

item.title: 坦桑尼亚的亲商立场带来红利，外国直接投资增加
item.description: 由于总统萨米亚-苏卢胡-哈桑（Samia Suluhu Hassan）的亲商立场有助于扭转其前任政策对投资者造成的影响，预计明年坦桑尼亚的外国投资将增长三分之一。【原文：Foreign investment in Tanzania is expected to grow by a third next year as President Samia Suluhu Hassan’s pro-business stance helps reverse the impact of her predecessor’s policies that antagonized investors.】

item.title: 谷歌人工智能交易获英国反垄断机构批准
item.description: 谷歌与人工智能公司 Anthropic 的合作避免了进一步的审查，因为英国监管机构表示，根据合并规则，这种合作不符合全面调查的条件。【原文：Google’s partnership with AI firm Anthropic has avoided further scrutiny after the UK watchdog said it doesn’t qualify for a full blown investigation under merger rules.】

item.title: 泰森比赛出现故障后，Netflix遇到了棘手问题
item.description: Netflix 吸引了 6000 多万观众观看它并不常见的直播活动。但是，在我们了解其中的起伏之前...【原文：Netflix attracted more than 60 million viewers to something it doesn’t often do: a live-streamed event. But before we get into the ups and downs of it...】

item.title: 反思对特朗普关税的最坏担忧
item.description: 在美国大选后的两周时间里，世界各国领导人和主要投资者一直在猜测，当选总统唐纳德-特朗普是否会完全兑现他在竞选时发出的征收普遍关税的威胁。【原文：World leaders and major investors have spent the two weeks since the US election wondering whether President-elect Donald Trump will follow through fully on his campaign threats to impose universal tariffs.】

item.title: 美联储历史表明，特朗普政策预期改变了美联储的观点
item.description: 我是克里斯-安斯蒂（Chris Anstey），波士顿的经济学编辑，今天我们来看看克雷格-托雷斯（Craig Torres）关于美联储对特朗普第一任期政策的猜测的报道。请将反馈和建议发送至 ecodaily@bloomberg.net，或通过 @economics 在 X 上与我们联系。如果您还没有注册，请点击这里。【原文：I’m Chris Anstey, an economics editor in Boston, and today we’re looking at Craig Torres’s reporting on Fed guesstimates of Trump policies in his first term. Send us feedback and tips to ecodaily@bloomberg.net or get in touch on X via @economics. And if you aren’t yet signed up to receive this newsletter, you can do so here.】

item.title: 石油短缺将挫败特朗普的 "压裂、压裂、压裂 "号召
item.description: 当选总统唐纳德-特朗普誓言 "压裂、压裂、压裂"，但全球原油供应过剩，最终将使创纪录的页岩油产量受到影响。【原文：President-elect Donald Trump’s vows to “frack, frack, frack” are about to collide with a global crude glut that’s set to, finally, temper record shale production.】

item.title: Instagram 将允许用户重置内容推荐
item.description: Meta Platforms Inc. 旗下的 Instagram 将允许部分用户重新设置内容推荐，这实质上是重新启动了决定用户在推送中看到哪些类型帖子和视频的算法。【原文：Meta Platforms Inc.’s Instagram will let some users reset their content recommendations, essentially restarting the algorithm that determines what types of posts and videos they see in their feed.】

item.title: Robinhood 拟斥资 3 亿美元收购 TradePMR，进军财富客户市场
item.description: Robinhood Markets Inc. 同意收购为注册投资顾问提供托管和投资组合管理平台的 TradePMR，因为这家在线经纪公司正试图面向更广泛的富裕投资者。【原文：Robinhood Markets Inc. agreed to buy TradePMR, a custodial and portfolio management platform for registered investment advisors, as the online brokerage seeks to target a wider swath of wealthier investors.】

item.title: 波兰股市领跌，反映俄罗斯风险升级
item.description: 由于俄罗斯扩大了使用核武器的范围，投资者将这个东欧国家的资产作为该地区风险升级的代表，波兰股票和兹罗提货币下跌。【原文：Polish stocks and the zloty currency dropped as investors used the Eastern European country’s assets as a proxy for escalating risk in the region as Russia widened its scope for using nuclear weapons.】

item.title: 欧洲股市以历史性优势输给美国股市
item.description: 很多金融大师都会说，分散投资的好处意味着你应该把大部分投资放在美国以外的地方。但多年来，选择欧洲（这里有沉寂的股市、脆弱的货币、危机四伏的政治体制和停滞不前的经济）一直是一个亏损的交易。唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）的减税和监管计划使美股更具吸引力，而欧洲则面临着对其最大公司征收新关税的问题，并有可能在今年年底之前对美国股市征收新的关税。【原文：Plenty of finance gurus will argue the benefits of diversification mean that you should put a chunk of your investments outside the US. But for years, choosing Europe — home to a dormant stock market, brittle currency, crisis-ridden political system and stagnant economy — has been a losing trade.Now those problems may get worse. Donald Trump's plans to cut taxes and gut regulation is making US stocks more attractive, and Europe faces new tariffs against its biggest companies and the prospect of】

item.title: 澳大利亚称养老金必须为退休潮做好准备
item.description: 澳大利亚政府正在提议对该国 3.9 万亿澳元（2.5 万亿美元）的养老金行业进行一系列改革，以便为未来十年约 250 万人的退休做好准备。【原文：The Australian government is proposing a raft of changes for the nation’s A$3.9 trillion ($2.5 trillion) pension industry, to prepare for the retirement of an estimated 2.5 million people over the next decade.】

item.title: 华尔街头号警察计划在特朗普上台前辞职
item.description: 美国曼哈顿最高检察官私下告诉人们，他将在唐纳德-特朗普 1 月份就职前卸任，这标志着他积极起诉华尔街犯罪的任期结束。【原文：The top US prosecutor in Manhattan has privately told people he’ll step down before Donald Trump is inaugurated in January, marking the end of his tenure aggressively prosecuting crimes across Wall Street.】

item.title: Amer Sports 第三季度销售额因中国市场超出预期
item.description: Amer Sports Inc. 公布的第三季度盈利超过了分析师的预期，表明这家芬兰体育用品制造商有望实现甚至超过其全年财务预期。【原文：Amer Sports Inc. reported third-quarter earnings that beat analysts’ estimate, indicating that the Finnish sports goods maker is on track to meet or even surpass its full-year financial outlook.】

item.title: 二十国集团会议召开之际，俄乌战争紧张局势加剧
item.description: 11 月 18 日，在巴西里约热内卢举行的二十国集团领导人峰会期间，与会者在现代艺术博物馆外。摄影师：Dado Galdieri/Bloomberg【原文：Attendees outside the Museum of Modern Art during the G-20 Leaders' Summit in Rio de Janeiro, Brazil, on Nov. 18. Photographer: Dado Galdieri/Bloomberg】

item.description:
我们将权力交给了那些希望我们更加孤独、更加受骗、更加分裂的人。【原文：

】

item.title: 英国央行行长贝利表示，雇主税率上升需要逐步降低税率
item.description: 英国央行行长安德鲁-贝利（Andrew Bailey）表示，英国政府提高雇主税率的举措意味着英国央行在监测对经济的影响时将不得不采取谨慎的态度来放宽借贷成本。【原文：The UK government’s move to raise taxes on employers means the Bank of England will have to take a cautious approach in easing borrowing costs as it monitors the effect on the economy, BOE Governor Andrew Bailey said.】

item.title: 鲍威尔对特朗普政策的观望态度与 2016 年截然不同
item.description: 美联储主席杰罗姆-鲍威尔（Jerome Powell）表示，他希望先观望即将上任的特朗普政府将实施哪些政策，然后再由央行预测其对经济的影响。【原文：Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell says he wants to wait and see what policies the incoming Trump administration will implement before the central bank forecasts what it means for the economy.】

item.title: Oura 与葡萄糖设备制造商 Dexcom 达成交易，估值 50 亿美元
item.description: 智能戒指制造商 Oura Health Oy 获得了医疗设备公司 Dexcom Inc. 7500 万美元的投资，为两家公司共享数据和交叉销售产品创造了条件。【原文：Smart ring maker Oura Health Oy is getting a $75 million investment from medical device firm Dexcom Inc., setting the stage for the two companies to share data and cross-sell products.】

item.title: 德国第三季度工资增幅为三十年来最大
item.description: 德国联邦银行（Bundesbank）的数据显示，尽管德国经济陷入停滞，但其工资却录得三十多年来最强劲的增长。【原文：Germany recorded the strongest wage growth in more than three decades despite its economy being mired in stagnation, according to the Bundesbank.】

item.title: 大型肉类加工企业认为巴西牛价高涨不会缓解压力
item.description: 南美一家顶级肉类包装公司的负责人表示，即使牧场主在 2025 年第一季度向市场投放更多牲畜，巴西的牛价仍将持续走高。【原文：Higher cattle prices are here to stay in Brazil even if ranchers bring more animals to market in the first quarter of 2025, according to the head of one of South America’s top meatpackers.】

item.title: 诺和诺德抹去 2024 年收益，抹去 2100 亿美元价值
item.description: 诺和诺德公司（Novo Nordisk A/S）股价周二再次下滑，短暂抹去了今年以来的高涨，原因是人们担心竞争的影响和供应限制会冷却这家丹麦公司生产肥胖症药物的热情。【原文：Novo Nordisk A/S shares slipped again on Tuesday, briefly erasing what was left of this year’s lofty gains, as concerns around the impact of competition and supply constraints cool the excitement around the Danish firm’s obesity drugs.】
